comment.body: @caryoscelus: I'm getting a layout default not found error on your short stories zite
@caryoscelus: np mate, really enjoy your albums btw

np, been listening to your albums during work again today btw. reminds me I should probably upload my own music files somewhere. I play mostly baroque and folk. I might also do some impro on yours ;-)
Been listening to Taking Out the Trash and Sounds of Ludum. Sea Alarm is really good too.

Used to be a big fan of FF, but it’s this kind of stunts that made me switch to the meme browser.
BTW, I don’t think it keeps a connection with those sites as such. Push API uses a connection to Mozilla servers, and sites using Push API can send there notification to mozilla who will redirect it to you. I still don’t like it, but it’s not as end-of-the-world as some people may think.
I've listened to all of your albums multiple times already, and although I'm not big on noise there were a couple that I really liked.
Just about to leave the office, can’t wait to listen to it when I get home.

Sorry for my late response, it's an issue that was brought up by someone else last week and the solution is as Pexo stated: you need the Demo GalleryHub+ to be able to clone. I will fix this as soon as I have time (i.e. after work today)
Have you signed the galleries/content.json as well? You can disable redirection in the configuration btw.
The settings are in a config file in the directory, the interface doesn't have the functionality for it yet. Managed to download your gallery btw.

I should set default to not redirect, implement the settings and maybe add a countdown or something so people can stop it if they don't want to be redirected. The idea was not to have to implement gallery browsing in two separate places.
removing it entirely or setting it to null should stop redirection.
@caryoscelus: Could be due to Tor? Onion addresses are rotated, so you could end up being counted multiple times with different addresses.
The inherent problem with decentralization is that it leads to fracturing.

Using linked data + hash-addressed content and if networks support the same hashing (ZN uses sha512, IPFS uses sha256, torrent used sha1 but I think switched) we could solve this. Communities on one network could then communicate with people on other networks and back.
nice, gonna listen to it when I get home
It's the start of the year, far too early to be lazy!

Vitamin D (i.e. sunlight) plays a large factor in resistance against diseases including KungFlu. You need direct sunlight, glass filters out the UVB rays that help your body produce Vitamin D. If you aren't allowed to go out and don't have a garden or balcony, try to get your hands on supplements.
And this is why we need deduplication.
@Kaffie: Malicious sites could use JS to reveal your ip as well.

@Kaffie: I wonder if we could get brave donations to work with ZeroNet, like how you can use it to donate to specific creators on e.g. Youtube and Github. I think it mostly depends on whether Brave developers are interested and I somewhat doubt they are. But verification could be done by signing something with the bitcoin private key, so I don't think it's technically all that difficult.
You're forgiven.
If you go into edit mode on your message there should be a 'Delete' button.
